title: Overview
content: Firemaking is primarily trained by burning logs at bonfires or in a line on the ground. Bonfires are more XP-efficient than line fires and benefit from a group XP bonus when other players join.
All logs can be bought from the Grand Exchange. Firemaking is largely a buyable skill, and many players choose to train it during Double XP events to reduce cost.

title: Levels 1-30: Normal and Oak Logs
content: Start by burning the cheapest logs available on a bonfire.
- Levels 1-15: Normal logs (40 XP each) — very cheap, widely available
- Levels 15-30: Oak logs (60 XP each) — slight upgrade, still low cost
Purchase logs from the Grand Exchange. Light a fire and continue adding logs to build a bonfire.

title: Levels 30-60: Willow, Teak, and Maple Logs
content: Mid-level Firemaking uses readily available logs. Teak gives more XP than willow and is often similarly priced.
- Levels 30-45: Willow logs (90 XP each)
- Levels 35-47: Teak logs (105 XP each) — better XP if available cheaply
- Levels 45-60: Maple logs (135 XP each) — standard mid-level log
Always use a bonfire rather than line fires for the group bonus when possible.

title: Levels 60-90: Yew and Magic Logs
content: Yew and magic logs are the primary training logs from 60 onwards. Both are commonly available on the Grand Exchange.
- Levels 60-75: Yew logs (202.5 XP each)
- Levels 75-90: Magic logs (303.8 XP each) — good XP per log, affordable in bulk
At high-traffic worlds, joining an existing bonfire group significantly boosts XP rates. Aim to burn at popular bonfire locations such as Edgeville or Burthorpe.

title: Levels 83-90: Curly Roots (Alternative)
content: Curly roots from the Jadinko Lair require 83 Woodcutting and 83 Firemaking, but give simultaneous XP in both skills with no supply cost — you chop curly jade roots from the ceiling and burn them in the nearby firepits.
- ~250,000 Firemaking XP/hr with Nature's Sentinel outfit and Ring of Fire
- ~70,000 Woodcutting XP/hr as a bonus
This is slower than bulk-buying magic or elder logs but costs nothing and is semi-AFK. A good option if you want to avoid Grand Exchange purchases or train Woodcutting at the same time.

title: Levels 90-110: Elder Logs
content: Elder logs provide the highest Firemaking XP per log in the game and are the go-to method from 90 to 110.
- Levels 90-110: Elder logs (506.3 XP each) — approximately 250,000–300,000 XP/hour at a group bonfire
Elder logs are expensive but significantly faster than magic logs. They can also be cut at an elder tree if you have 90 Woodcutting.
At a busy bonfire with group bonus stacked, elder logs reach peak efficiency.

title: Boosts and Tips
content: - Bonfire group bonus: Up to 10% bonus XP when multiple players join the same bonfire (up to ~5 players)
- Inferno Adze: Automatically burns some logs while cutting trees — useful for Woodcutting + Firemaking training together
- Pyre logs: Burning specific logs on funeral pyres in Shades of Mort'ton gives bonus XP and useful drops; slower but Ironman-friendly
- Beacons: Lighting all 14 beacons simultaneously unlocks the Ring of Fire and Flame gloves for XP bonuses
- Modified pyre costume: Full set grants bonus Firemaking XP — useful if obtainable from Treasure Hunter
- Double XP events: Train heavily during DXP to reduce the cost of elder logs significantly
